intro: Commiphora pervilleana, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It produces a resinous sap that is used in traditional medicine and perfumery. The botanical features of Commiphora pervilleana make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
